description: SNMP Notification representing Conditions/Alarms
raised by Infinera Network Elements
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsAlarm INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsName s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXA INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::objectType s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::objectName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::sessionNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsProbableCause s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neProbableCause s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::perceivedSeverity i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::assertedSeverity i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::serviceAffecting i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::category i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::probableCauseDescription s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::proposedRepairActions s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::additionalText s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsCorrelationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neCorrelationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::circuitId s EXAMPLE

description: The Notification ID generated by EMS for
each trap forwarded to NBI/OSS.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsNotificationId

description: Maps to the Notification ID generated
by Infinera NE. Since this is specific
to each NE, the NE Name attribute should
be used in conjunction with this attribute.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neNotificationId

description: ems time in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.mmmm<Z>
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsTime

description: ne time in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.mmmm<Z>
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neTime

description: EMS Name or IP Address of the EMS Server.
This is useful if one NBI Client connects
to more than EMS and receives traps. Default is Infinera
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsName

description: The Name of the network element. This maps
to the ME Name of the Info Model.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neName

description: The Node ID of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neNodeId

description: Represents MO Type on Infinera Info Mode/XML Interface
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::objectType

description: Represents AID of an object
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::objectName

description: Represents the notification ID on a per session
basis. This will allow individual OSS clients to
retrieve missing traps in that session.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::sessionNotificationId

description: EMS Probable Cause. Represents
probableCause in TMF 814
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsProbableCause

description: NE probabale cause. Represents
nativeProbableCause in TMF 814
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neProbableCause

description: Perceived Severity.
Maps to perceivedSeverity in TMF 814 and
Infinera XML interface.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::perceivedSeverity

description: The severity with which this alarm was asserted.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::assertedSeverity

description: The value specifies if the alarm is
for a service affecting condition or not.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::serviceAffecting

description: Represents the category of the object that
caused the alarm.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::category

description: Descriptive text for the probableCause
attribute. The term is mapped to the
probableCauseDescription field of alarms
raised by Infinera Network Elements
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::probableCauseDescription

description: If the cause of the alarm is known,
the EMS can suggest one or more solutions
to the problem. Not Mandatory
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::proposedRepairActions

description: Additional text describing the alarm
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::additionalText

description: Represents the correlation ID generated by
the EMS.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsCorrelationId

description: Represents the correlation ID generated by
the Network Element.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::neCorrelationId

description: Represents the circuit id of the service carried by the source of this alarm
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::circuitId

description: SNMP Notification representing Audit events
generated by Infinera Network elements

event.Summary: User $v10 performed audit operation $v12 on $v11. Status: $v13

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsAudit INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditEmsNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditEmsTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditEmsName s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXA INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditObjectType s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditObjectName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditAccountName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditClientHostName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditOperationName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditOperationStatus s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditParamList s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::sessionNotificationId i 9999

description: The Notification ID generated by EMS for
each trap forwarded to NBI/OSS.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditEmsNotificationId

description: Maps to the Notification ID generated
by Infinera NE. Since this is specific
to each NE, the NE Name attribute should
be used in conjunction with this attribute.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeNotificationId

description: ems time in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.mmmm<Z>
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditEmsTime

description: ne time in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.mmmm<Z>
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeTime

description: EMS Name or IP Address of the EMS Server.
This is useful if one NBI Client connects
to more than EMS and receives traps. Default is Infinera
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditEmsName

description: The Name of the network element. This maps
to the ME Name of the Info Model.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeName

description: The Node ID of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditNeNodeId

description: Represents MO Type on Infinera Info Mode/XML Interface
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditObjectType

description: Represents AID of an object
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditObjectName

description: ID of the user who performed this operation.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditAccountName

description: IP address or host name from which the
operation was performed.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditClientHostName

description: The operation type which resulted in this
Audit event.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditOperationName

description: The status of the operation for this Audit
Event. Could be success or failure etc.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditOperationStatus

description: This attribute contains DisplayString data in
comma separated format. The data represents the
attributes and their values that got
affected by the operation which resulted
in this Audit event.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::auditParamList

description: Represents the notification ID on a per session
basis. This will allow individual OSS clients to
retrieve missing traps in that session.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::sessionNotificationId

description: SNMP Notification representing TCA events
generated by Infinera Network elements
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::emsTCA INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaEmsNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeNotificationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaEmsTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeTime s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaEmsName s EXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXAMPLEEXA INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeNodeId s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaObjectType s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaObjectName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaClearableState i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaParameterName s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaLocation s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaThresholdType s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaThresholdValue s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaCurrentValue s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaGranularity s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaPerceivedSeverity i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaAssertedSeverity i 1 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeCorrelationId i 9999 INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaProbableCauseDescription s EXAMPLE INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::sessionNotificationId i 9999

description: The Notification ID generated by EMS for
each trap forwarded to NBI/OSS.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaEmsNotificationId

description: Maps to the Notification ID generated
by Infinera NE. Since this is specific
to each NE, the NE Name attribute should
be used in conjunction with this attribute.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeNotificationId

description: ems time in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.mmmm<Z>
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaEmsTime

description: ne time in ISO 8601 format YYYY-MM-DD<space>hh:mm:ss.mmmm<Z>
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeTime

description: EMS Name or IP Address of the EMS Server.
This is useful if one NBI Client connects
to more than EMS and receives traps. Default is Infinera
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaEmsName

description: The Name of the network element. This maps
to the ME Name of the Info Model.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeName

description: The Node ID of the network element.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeNodeId

description: Represents MO Type on Infinera Info Mode/XML Interface
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaObjectType

description: Represents AID of an object
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaObjectName

description: Represents whether this TCA is clearable or not.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaClearableState

description: Represents the register/parameter name information
where the threshold changes are happening (e.g. Errored Seconds).
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaParameterName

description: Represents the location of the source for
this threshold (near end/far end etc.).
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaLocation

description: Represents the type of the threshold
(e.g. high threshold or low threshold crossed/cleared etc.).
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaThresholdType

description: Value that represents the configured threshold value.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaThresholdValue

description: Value that represents the current threshold value.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaCurrentValue

description: Value that represents the granularity of the event
(e.g. 15-min/24-hour/unknown etc.).
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaGranularity

description: Perceived Severity.
Maps to perceivedSeverity in TMF 814 and
Infinera XML interface.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaPerceivedSeverity

description: The severity with which this TCA was asserted.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaAssertedSeverity

description: Represents the TCA correlation ID generated by
the Network Element.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaNeCorrelationId

description: Value that represents the description of probable cause.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::tcaProbableCauseDescription

description: Represents the notification ID on a per session
basis. This will allow individual OSS clients to
retrieve missing traps in that session.
variables.name: INFINERA-TRAP-MIB::sessionNotificationId
